1837                detected_circles.append((x_peaks[0], y_peaks[0], r))
1838    
1839            # Live animation (if enabled)
1840            if live_plot:
1841                ax.clear()
1842                ax.imshow(image, cmap=self.parent.cmap)
1843                plt.title(f"Detecting Circles: Radius {r}px")
1844                for x, y, rad in detected_circles:
1845                    plt.axis("off")
1846                    circ = plt.Circle((x, y), rad, color='red', 
1847                                      fill=False, linewidth=1)
1848                    ax.add_patch(circ)
1849                plt.pause(0.3)
1850    
1851        ## (3) Final detected circle ------------------------------------------
1852        accums ,self.x,self.y,self.r = hough_circle_peaks(
1853            hough_circle(edges, radii),
1854            radii,
1855            total_num_peaks=5
1856        )
1857        
1858        
1859        self.x, self.y, self.r = \
1860            float(self.x[0]), float(self.y[0]), float(self.r[0])
1861    
1862        ## (4) User information -----------------------------------------------
1863        if (self.parent.verbose or self.parent.final_print):
1864            self.parent.dText = \
1865                "Center Determination (HoughTransform) : ({:.3f}, {:.3f})".\
1866                    format(self.x, self.y)
1867    
1868        ## (5) Final plot with all detected circles (if enabled) --------------
1869        if live_plot:
1870            plt.ioff()  # Turn off interactive mode
1871            plt.close("all")
1872        
1873        
1874            fig_final, ax_final = plt.subplots()
1875            ax_final.imshow(image, cmap=self.parent.cmap)
1876            plt.title("Hough Transform Preliminary Detection")
1877        
1878            for x, y, rad in detected_circles:
1879                circ = plt.Circle((x, y), rad, color='blue', 
1880                                  fill=False, linewidth=1)
1881                ax_final.add_patch(circ)
1882        
1883            # Highlight the final detected circle (red)
1884            circ_final = plt.Circle((self.x, self.y), self.r, 
1885                                    color='red', fill=False, 
1886                                    linewidth=2, label="Selected Circle")
1887            plt.scatter(self.x, self.y, color="red", marker='x', s=60, lw=1)
1888            ax_final.add_patch(circ_final)
1889        
1890            # Create a single blue circle just for the legend
1891            legend_blue = plt.Line2D([0], [0], 
1892                                     color='blue', 
1893                                     linewidth=1, 
1894                                     linestyle='-', 
1895                                     label="Searching Space")
1896        
1897            # Add the legend
1898            ax_final.legend(handles=[legend_blue, circ_final])
1899            plt.axis("off")
1900            plt.tight_layout()
1901
1902            plt.show()
1903    
1904        # Close live plot (to avoid non-closed windows in Jupyter)
1905        plt.close("all")
1906        
1907        ## (6) Final detected circle visualization (if requested) --------------
1908        if plot_results:
1909            self.visualize_center(self.x, self.y, self.r)
1910    
1911        return self.x, self.y, self.r
1912
1913   
1914    def detection_curvefit(self, plot_results=False):
1915        """
1916        Detects the center of a diffraction pattern by fitting a 2D pseudo-Voigt 
1917        function to the central region of the image.
1918     
1919        This method:
1920            - Crops a square region around the image center.
1921            - Fits a 2D pseudo-Voigt peak to the cropped region.
1922            - Returns the refined center coordinates in the original image space.
1923            - Optionally visualizes the result.
1924            - Falls back to the crop center if fitting fails.
1925     
1926        Parameters
1927        ----------
1928        plot_results : bool, optional, default=False
1929            If True, displays the fitted center location on the image. 
1930     
1931        Returns
1932        -------
1933        x : float
1934            Refined x-coordinate of the center (column index).
1935            
1936        y : float
1937            Refined y-coordinate of the center (row index).
1938
1939        """
1940    
1941        def pseudo_voigt_2d(xy, amp, x0, y0, sigma_x, sigma_y, eta):
1942            """
1943            Computes a 2D pseudo-Voigt function, which is a linear combination 
1944            of a Gaussian and a Lorentzian function.
1945        
1946            Parameters
1947            ----------
1948            xy : tuple of numpy.ndarray
1949                A tuple (x, y) containing coordinate meshgrids.
1950                
1951            amp : float
1952                Amplitude of the peak.
1953                
1954            x0, y0 : float
1955                Coordinates of the center of the peak.
1956                
1957            sigma_x, sigma_y : float
1958                Width (standard deviation) of the peak along the x and y axes.
1959                
1960            eta : float
1961                Mixing parameter (0 = pure Gaussian, 1 = pure Lorentzian).
1962        
1963            Returns
1964            -------
1965            numpy.ndarray
1966                Flattened 1D array of function values evaluated at the input 
1967                coordinates.
1968            """
1969            x, y = xy
1970            r_x = (x - x0) / sigma_x
1971            r_y = (y - y0) / sigma_y
1972    
1973            gaussian = np.exp(-(r_x**2 + r_y**2) / 2)
1974            lorentzian = 1 / (1 + r_x**2 + r_y**2)
1975    
1976            return amp * ((1 - eta) * gaussian + eta * lorentzian)
1977        
1978        # Define crop size around the center of the image
1979        crop_size = 100
1980        
1981        # Make a copy of the image to avoid modifying the original
1982        image = np.copy(self.parent.to_refine)
1983        
1984        # Get the image dimensions
1985        h, w = image.shape
1986        
1987        # Estimate the center of the image
1988        x_center, y_center = w // 2, h // 2
1989    
1990        # Calculate the bounds of the cropped square region
1991        half_crop = crop_size // 2
1992        x_min, x_max = max(0, x_center - half_crop), min(w, x_center + half_crop)
1993        y_min, y_max = max(0, y_center - half_crop), min(h, y_center + half_crop)
1994    
1995        # Crop the image around the center for curve fitting
1996        cropped_image = image[y_min:y_max, x_min:x_max]
1997    
1998        # Create a meshgrid of x and y coordinates for the cropped region
1999        x, y = np.meshgrid(np.arange(cropped_image.shape[1]),
2000                           np.arange(cropped_image.shape[0]))
2001        
2002        # Flatten the meshgrid coordinates and image for use with curve fitting
2003        x_flat, y_flat = x.ravel(), y.ravel()
2004        image_flat = cropped_image.ravel()
2005
2006        # Set initial parameter guesses for curve fitting:
2007        # [amplitude, x0, y0, sigma_x, sigma_y, eta]    
2008        initial_guess = [
2009            np.max(cropped_image),
2010            crop_size // 2,
2011            crop_size // 2,
2012            max(1, crop_size / 5),
2013            max(1, crop_size / 5),
2014            0.5
2015        ]
2016        
2017        # Define bounds for each parameter during optimization
2018        bounds = (
2019            [0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 0],
2020            [np.inf, crop_size, crop_size, crop_size, crop_size, 1]
2021        )
2022    
2023        try:
2024            # Fit the pseudo-Voigt function to the cropped image
2025            popt, _ = curve_fit(
2026                pseudo_voigt_2d,
2027                (x_flat, y_flat),
2028                image_flat,
2029                p0=initial_guess,
2030                bounds=bounds,
2031                max_nfev=2000  # increase if needed
2032            )
2033            
2034            # Extract refined x and y center coordinates from fit
2035            x_refined, y_refined = popt[1], popt[2]
2036            used_fallback = False
2037    
2038        except RuntimeError:
2039            # If fitting fails, fall back to geometric center 
2040            x_refined, y_refined = crop_size // 2, crop_size // 2
2041            used_fallback = True
2042            
2043        # Add the offset of the cropped region to get coordinates in full image
2044        self.x, self.y = x_refined + x_min, y_refined + y_min
2045        
2046        # Print the result if verbose are enabled
2047        if self.parent.verbose or self.parent.final_print:
2048            self.parent.dText = (
2049                f"Center Determination (CurveFitting) :   ({self.x:.3f}, {self.y:.3f})"
2050                + (" [fallback]" if used_fallback else "")
2051            )
2052            
2053        # Optionally show the result visually
2054        if plot_results:
2055            self.visualize_center(self.x, self.y, 100)
2056    
2057        return self.x, self.y, None
2058
2059
2060    def detection_3points(self, plot_results=0):
2061        '''         
2062        Semi-automated detection of the diffraction pattern center using manual 
2063        selection of 3 points.
2064
2065        This method allows the user to manually select 3 points along a visible 
2066        diffraction ring in the image to define a circle. Once selected, 
2067        the center and radius of the circle are automatically computed. After 
2068        that, the user can manually adjust the center position using
2069        an interactive interface.
2070
2071        User Controls (during point selection)
2072        --------------------------------------
2073        - **'1'**: Add a point at the current mouse cursor position 
2074                         (max 3 points).
2075        - **'2'**: Delete the most recently added point.
2076        - **'3'**: Delete the point closest to the mouse cursor.
2077        - **'d'**: When 3 points are selected (DONE), proceed 
2078        - **Close**    : Terminate the process without detecting a center.
2079        
2080        Parameters
2081        ----------
2082        plot_results : int, binary, default=0
2083            Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user.
2084        
2085        Returns
2086        -------
2087        self.x : float64
2088            x-coordinate of the detected center
2089            
2090        self.y : float64
2091            y-coordinate of the detected center
2092            
2093        self.r : float64
2094            radius of the detected center
2095            (if available, othervise returns None)
2096                                    
2097        '''
2098        # (0) Load and prepare image ------------------------------------------
2099        im = self.parent.to_refine
2100        
2101        # Edit contrast with a user-predefined parameter
2102        if self.parent.icut is not None:
2103            if self.parent.verbose==2:
2104                print("Contrast enhanced.")
2105            im = np.where(im > self.parent.icut, 
2106                              self.parent.icut, 
2107                              im)
2108            
2109        # (2) Create a figure and display the image ---------------------------
2110        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 12)) 
2111        
2112        # Allow using arrows to move back and forth between view ports
2113        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].append('left')
2114        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].append('right')
2115 
2116        plt.title("Select 3 points defining one of diffraction circles", 
2117                  fontsize = 20)
2118        ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.parent.cmap, origin="upper")
2119        ax.axis('off')
2120
2121        # (3) User information ------------------------------------------------
2122        instructions = dedent(
2123            """
2124            CenterDetermination :: ThreePoints (semi-automated method)
2125            Select 3 points to define a diffraction circle using keys:
2126              - '1' : define a point at current cursor position
2127              - '2' : delete the last point
2128              - '3' : delete the point closest to the cursor
2129              - 'd' : done = finished = go to the next step
2130            Close the figure to terminate. No center will be detected.
2131            """)
2132
2133        if (self.parent.verbose==1 or self.parent.verbose==2):
2134            print(instructions)
2135       
2136        # (4) Enable interactive mode -----------------------------------------
2137        # (figure is updated after every plotting command
2138        # (so that calling figure.show() is not necessary
2139        plt.ion()
2140 
2141        # (5) Initialization
2142        # Initialize the list of coordinates
2143        self.coords = [] 
2144        
2145        # Initialize all flags and counters
2146        calculate_circle_flag = False          # press 'd' event
2147        termination_flag = False               # close window event
2148        point_counter = 0                      # number of selected points
2149        
2150        # (6) Define the event handler for figure close event -----------------
2151        def onclose(event):
2152            nonlocal termination_flag
2153            termination_flag = True
2154            if self.parent.verbose==2:
2155                print('Execution terminated.')
2156                print("------------------------------------------------------------")
2157
2158 
2159        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
2160        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
2161        
2162        
2163        # (7) Define the callback function for key press events ---------------
2164        def onkeypress(event):
2165            # nonlocal to modify the flag variable in the outer scope
2166            nonlocal calculate_circle_flag, point_counter, termination_flag
2167            
2168            # Store the zoom level
2169            current_xlim = ax.get_xlim()
2170            current_ylim = ax.get_ylim()
2171 
2172            ## Delete points -- the closest to the cursor
2173            if event.key == '3':
2174                point_counter -= 1
2175                if len(self.coords) > 0:
2176                    pointer_x, pointer_y = event.xdata, event.ydata
2177                    distances = [
2178                        np.sqrt((x - pointer_x)**2 + (y - pointer_y)**2)
2179                        for x, y in self.coords]
2180                    closest_index = np.argmin(distances)
2181                    del self.coords[closest_index]
2182    
2183                    ## Redraw the image without the deleted point
2184                    ax.clear()
2185                    ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.parent.cmap,
2186                              origin="upper")
2187                    for x, y in self.coords:
2188                        ax.scatter(x, y, 
2189                                   c='r', marker='x', 
2190                                   s=self.parent.marker_size)
2191
2192                    my_plot_title = (
2193                        "Select 3 points to define "
2194                        "one of diffraction circles.")
2195                    plt.title(my_plot_title, fontsize=20)
2196                    
2197                    # Retore the previous zoom level
2198                    ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
2199                    ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
2200                    ax.axis('off')
2201                    
2202                    fig.canvas.draw()
2203                else:
2204                    print("No points to delete.")
2205    
2206            # Delete recent point (last added) -- independent on the cursor
2207            if event.key == '2':
2208                # Check if there are points to delete
2209                if point_counter > 0:  
2210                    point_counter -= 1
2211                    if len(self.coords) > 0:
2212                        # Delete the last point in the list
2213                        del self.coords[-1]
2214    
2215                        # Redraw the image without the deleted point
2216                        ax.clear()
2217                        ax.imshow(im, cmap=self.parent.cmap,
2218                                  origin="upper")
2219                        for x, y in self.coords:
2220                            ax.scatter(x, y,
2221                                       c='r', marker='x', 
2222                                       s=self.parent.marker_size)
2223
2224                        my_plot_title = (
2225                            "Select 3 points to define "
2226                            "one of diffraction circles.")
2227                        plt.title(my_plot_title)
2228                        
2229                        # Retore the previous zoom level
2230                        ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
2231                        ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
2232                        ax.axis('off')
2233
2234                        fig.canvas.draw()
2235                else:
2236                    print("No points to delete.")
2237                    
2238            ## Select points 
2239            elif event.key == '1':
2240                # Only allow selecting up to three points
2241                if point_counter < 3:  
2242                    # Save the coordinates of the clicked point
2243                    new_point = (event.xdata, event.ydata)
2244                    
2245                    if new_point in self.coords:
2246                        # Do not allow multiple selection of one point
2247                        print("The selected point already exists.")
2248                    else:
2249                        # Add selected point
2250                        self.coords.append(new_point)
2251    
2252                        # Visualize the selected point on the image
2253                        ax.scatter(event.xdata, event.ydata, 
2254                                   c='r', marker='x', 
2255                                   s=self.parent.marker_size)
2256
2257                        # Restore the previous zoom level
2258                        ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
2259                        ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
2260                        ax.axis('off')
2261
2262                        fig.canvas.draw()
2263    
2264                        point_counter += 1
2265
2266    
2267                if len(self.coords) == 3:
2268                    # Turn off interactive mode
2269                    plt.ioff()
2270    
2271
2272    
2273            # (8) Calculate circle or terminate -------------------------------
2274            elif event.key == 'd':
2275                if len(self.coords) == 3:
2276                    calculate_circle_flag = True
2277 
2278                else:
2279                    print("Select exactly 3 points to calculate the circle.")
2280                    fig.canvas.draw()
2281    
2282        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
2283        cid0 = fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress)
2284
2285        # Show the plot 
2286        plt.tight_layout()
2287        ax.axis('off')
2288
2289        plt.show(block=False)
2290      
2291        # Wait for 'd' key event or close the figure if no points are selected
2292        while not calculate_circle_flag and not termination_flag:
2293 
2294            try:
2295                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
2296                # Store the zoom level
2297                current_xlim = ax.get_xlim()
2298                current_ylim = ax.get_ylim()
2299 
2300                # Plot detected diffraction pattern
2301                if calculate_circle_flag:
2302 
2303                    self.calculate_circle(plot_results=0)
2304                    
2305                    ax.clear()
2306                    ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.parent.cmap,
2307                              origin="upper")
2308                    # Retore the previous zoom level
2309                    ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
2310                    ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
2311                 
2312                    circle = plt.Circle(
2313                        (self.x, self.y), self.r, color='r', fill=False)
2314                    ax.add_artist(circle)
2315        
2316                    # Plot center point
2317                    center, = ax.plot(self.x, self.y, 'rx', markersize=12)
2318                    plt.title('Manually adjust the position of the center using keys.')
2319        
2320                    # Display the image
2321                    plt.draw()
2322                    ax.axis('off')
2323
2324                    plt.show(block = False)
2325
2326            except KeyboardInterrupt:
2327                print("Execution manually interrupted by user.")
2328                break
2329            except ValueError as e:
2330                print("ValueError:", e)
2331                break
2332           
2333        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
2334        if termination_flag: 
2335             print("No points selected. Returned None values.")
2336             sys.exit()
2337             return None, None, None
2338        
2339        # Disconnect key press events
2340        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(cid0) 
2341        
2342        # local variables save
2343        self.center = center
2344        
2345        self.backip = [self.x, self.y, self.r]
2346        # Manually adjust the calculated center coordinates
2347        self.x, self.y, self.r = self.adjustment_3points(fig, circle, center)
2348
2349        # Return the results:
2350        # a) XY-coordinates of the center
2351        # b) radius of the circle/diff.ring,
2352        #    from which the center was determined
2353        return(self.x, self.y, self.r)
2354    
2355    
2356    def adjustment_3points(self, fig, circle, center, plot_results=0) -> tuple:
2357        """
2358        Manual/interactive refinement of the diffraction pattern center
2359        after initial detection via 3 points.
2360
2361        User Controls (during point selection)
2362        --------------------------------------
2363        This method allows the user to fine-tune the estimated
2364        center and radius of a diffraction ring,
2365        (which was determined manually by selecting 3 points)
2366        by means of the following interactive keyboard controls:
2367
2368        - Arrow keys (, , , ): Move the center left, right, up, or down
2369        - **'+'** : Increase the radius
2370        - **'-'** : Decrease the radius
2371        - **'b'** : Increase step size (5)
2372        - **'l'** : Decrease step size (/5, with minimum step size 0.5)
2373        - **'d'**: Done  finalize the center and radius
2374        - Closing the figure: Cancels refinement and returns the original input 
2375          center and radius
2376
2377        Parameters
2378        ----------
2379        fig : matplotlib.figure.Figure
2380            The figure window used for interactive refinement.
2381            
2382        circle : matplotlib.patches.Circle
2383            The circle object initially defined from 3 selected points.
2384            
2385        center : tuple
2386            The initial (x, y) center coordinates estimated from the selected 
2387            points.
2388            
2389        plot_results : bool, optional, default=False
2390            If True, the results of the adjustment are visualized.
2391
2392        Returns
2393        -------
2394        xy[0] : float
2395            x-coordinate of the adjusted center of the diffraction pattern.
2396            
2397        xy[1] : float
2398            y-coordinate of the adjusted center of the diffraction pattern.
2399            
2400        r : float
2401            Adjusted radius of the diffraction ring.
2402
2403        Notes
2404        -----
2405        - Interactive adjustments are visualized in real time.
2406        - Intensity sum at the current center/radius is printed if print_sums
2407          is True.
2408        - Arrow key defaults in Matplotlib (e.g., navigation) are temporarily 
2409          disabled to allow movement control.
2410        """
2411                    
2412        # Remove default left / right arrow key press events
2413        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].remove('left')
2414        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].remove('right')
2415        
2416        if (self.parent.verbose==1 or self.parent.verbose==2):
2417            instructions = dedent(
2418            """
2419            CenterDetermination :: ThreePoints (interactive adjustment)
2420            Use these keys:
2421              - '' : move left
2422              - '' : move right
2423              - '' : move up
2424              - '' : move down
2425              - '+' : increase circle radius
2426              - '-' : decrease circle radius
2427              - 'b' : increase step size
2428              - 'l' : decrease step size
2429              - 'd' : refinement done
2430                  
2431            DISCLAIMER: For the purpose of the center position adjustment, 
2432                        the default shortcuts for arrows were removed.
2433            """)
2434            print(instructions)
2435        
2436        if self.parent.print_sums:
2437            print("Intensity sums during refinement:")
2438            
2439        # Initialize variables and flags
2440        self.backip = np.array((self.x, self.y))
2441        xy = np.array((self.x, self.y))
2442        r = np.copy(self.r)
2443        termination_flag = False
2444        
2445        plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
2446
2447        plt.ion()
2448          
2449        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
2450        def onclose(event):
2451            nonlocal termination_flag
2452            termination_flag = True
2453
2454        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
2455        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
2456        
2457        # Define the callback function for key press events
2458        def onkeypress2(event):
2459            # Use nonlocal to modify the center position in the outer scope
2460            nonlocal xy, r, termination_flag
2461        
2462            # OTHER KEYS USED IN INTERACTIVE FIGURES
2463            #   event.key == '1': select a point in self.detection_3points()
2464            #   event.key == '2': delete the last point in self.detection...
2465            #   event.key == '3': delete a point in self.detection...
2466            #   event.key == '+': increase circle radius
2467            #   event.key == '-': decrease circle radius           
2468            #   event.key == 'b': increase the step size (big step size)
2469            #   event.key == 'l': decrease the step size (little step size)
2470            #   event.key == 'd': proceed in self.detection_3points()
2471        
2472            if event.key in ['up', 'down', 'left', 'right', '+', '-']:                    
2473                if event.key in ['+', '-']:
2474                    r += 1 if event.key == '+' else -1
2475                else:
2476                    # Perform shifts normally
2477                    if event.key == 'up':
2478                        xy[1] -= self.step
2479                    elif event.key == 'down':
2480                        xy[1] += self.step
2481                    elif event.key == 'left':
2482                        xy[0] -= self.step
2483                    elif event.key == 'right':
2484                        xy[0] += self.step
2485                    
2486                    # Print sum only for arrow keys
2487                    if self.parent.print_sums:
2488                        s = self.parent.intensity_sum(self.parent.to_refine, 
2489                                                      xy[0], xy[1], r)
2490                        print(f'{s:.2f}')
2491            
2492            # Terminate the interactive refinement with 'd' key
2493            if event.key == 'd':
2494                termination_flag = True
2495        
2496            # Change step size 
2497            if event.key == 'b':
2498                self.step = self.step * 5
2499        
2500            if event.key == 'l':
2501                self.step = self.step / 5
2502                if self.step < 0.5:
2503                    self.step = 0.5
2504        
2505            # Update the plot with the new center position
2506            circle.set_center((xy[0], xy[1]))  # circle
2507            circle.set_radius(r)               # radius
2508            center.set_data([xy[0]], [xy[1]])  # center
2509        
2510            plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
2511        
2512            # Update the plot
2513            plt.draw()
2514
2515                
2516        # Disconnect the on_key_press1 event handler from the figure
2517        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(fig.canvas.manager.key_press_handler_id)
2518        
2519        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
2520        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress2)
2521
2522        # Enable interaction mode
2523        plt.ion() 
2524               
2525        # Wait for 'd' key press or figure closure
2526        while not termination_flag:
2527            try:
2528                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
2529            except KeyboardInterrupt:
2530                # If the user manually closes the figure, terminate the loop
2531                termination_flag = True
2532                
2533        # Turn off interactive mode
2534        plt.ioff()
2535        
2536        # Display the final figure with the selected center position and radius
2537        plt.tight_layout()
2538
2539        plt.show(block=False)
2540        
2541        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
2542        if termination_flag: 
2543            plt.close()  # Close the figure
2544
2545        # User information:
2546        if (self.parent.verbose or self.parent.final_print):
2547            self.parent.dText = "Center Determination (ThreePoints)    : ({:.3f}, {:.3f})"
2548        
2549    
2550        return xy[0], xy[1], r
2551        
2552
2553    def calculate_circle(self, plot_results:int)->tuple[
2554            float,float,float,tuple[float,float], plt.Circle]:
2555        """
2556        Calculate the center and radius of a circle defined by 3 manually 
2557        selected points.
2558
2559        Given three user-defined points (typically on a diffraction ring), this 
2560        method computes the center and radius of the circle that passes through 
2561        them. Optionally, it visualizes the result including the circle, center, 
2562        and selected points overlaid on the image.
2563
2564        Parameters
2565        ----------
2566        plot_results : int (binary: 0 or 1)
2567            If 1, displays the image with the fitted circle and center.
2568            If 0, skips visualization.
2569
2570        Returns
2571        -------
2572        self.x : float
2573            x-coordinate of the detected circle center.
2574
2575        self.y : float
2576            y-coordinate of the detected circle center.
2577
2578        self.r : float
2579            Radius of the detected circle.
2580
2581        self.center : tuple[float, float]
2582            The (x, y) coordinates of the circle center.
2583
2584        self.circle : matplotlib.patches.Circle
2585            A matplotlib Circle object that can be reused for future plotting.
2586
2587        Notes
2588        -----
2589        - The method uses a geometric approach to calculate the circumcenter
2590          and circumradius.
2591        - For best visual results, ensure the selected points are well spaced 
2592          and belong to the same circular ring.
2593        """
2594        # Extract the coordinates of the points        
2595        x = [self.coords[0][0], self.coords[1][0], self.coords[2][0]]
2596        y = [self.coords[0][1], self.coords[1][1], self.coords[2][1]]
2597        
2598        # Compute the radius and center coordinates of the circle
2599            # a: the squared length of the side between the second 
2600            #    and third points (x[1], y[1]) and (x[2], y[2]).
2601            # b: the squared length of the side between the first 
2602            #    and third points (x[0], y[0]) and (x[2], y[2]).
2603            # c: the squared length of the side between the first 
2604            #    and second points (x[0], y[0]) and (x[1], y[1]).
2605            # s: the twice the signed area of the triangle formed by 3 points
2606            
2607        c = (x[0]-x[1])**2 + (y[0]-y[1])**2
2608        a = (x[1]-x[2])**2 + (y[1]-y[2])**2
2609        b = (x[2]-x[0])**2 + (y[2]-y[0])**2
2610        s = 2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) - (a*a + b*b + c*c) 
2611        
2612        # coordinates of the center
2613        self.x = (a*(b+c-a)*x[0] + b*(c+a-b)*x[1] + c*(a+b-c)*x[2]) / s
2614        self.y = (a*(b+c-a)*y[0] + b*(c+a-b)*y[1] + c*(a+b-c)*y[2]) / s 
2615        
2616        # radius
2617        ar = a**0.5
2618        br = b**0.5
2619        cr = c**0.5 
2620        self.r = ar*br*cr/((ar+br+cr)*(-ar+br+cr)*(ar-br+cr)*(ar+br-cr))**0.5
2621        
2622        # # Print results
2623        # if self.parent.verbose:
2624        #     print("CenterEstimator :: manual center detection")
2625        #     print(f"Center coordinates: {self.x:.2f} {self.y:.2f}")
2626                    
2627        if plot_results==1:
2628            # Create and manage the figure
2629            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
2630            manager = plt.get_current_fig_manager()
2631            manager.window.showMaximized()
2632            ax.imshow(self.parent.image, cmap = self.parent.cmap,
2633                      origin="upper")
2634            
2635            # Plot center and points
2636            center, = plt.plot(self.x, self.y, 
2637                     'rx', 
2638                     label='Center', 
2639                     markersize=12)
2640            plt.scatter(x,y, 
2641                        marker='x', 
2642                        color='palevioletred', 
2643                        label = 'Circle points')
2644            plt.title('Circle found using 3 manually detected points')
2645            
2646            # Circle visualization
2647            circle = plt.Circle((self.x,self.y), 
2648                                self.r, 
2649                                color='palevioletred', 
2650                                fill=False,
2651                                label = 'pattern')
2652            ax.add_artist(circle)
2653            
2654            # Set the aspect ratio to equal to have a circular shape
2655            plt.axis('equal')
2656            
2657            plt.legend(loc='lower center', 
2658                       ncol=2, 
2659                       bbox_to_anchor=(0.5,-0.1), 
2660                       mode='expand', 
2661                       frameon=False)
2662            plt.axis('off')
2663            plt.tight_layout()
2664            plt.show(block=False)
2665
2666        
2667        self.center = (self.x, self.y)
2668        self.circle = plt.Circle((self.x,self.y),self.r)
2669        
2670
2671        return self.x, self.y, self.r, self.center, self.circle
2672
2673
2674    def get_radius(
2675            self, rtype:int, im:np.ndarray, x:float, y:float, disp:bool=False) -> float:
2676        """
2677        Calculate the radius of a circle based on intensity profiles along 
2678        horizontal and vertical axes.
2679    
2680        Parameters
2681        ----------
2682        rtype : integer
2683            Method for radius calculation. Default is 0.
2684            - rtype=0 : peaks matching method
2685            - rtype=1 : radial distribution method
2686            
2687        im : np.ndarray
2688            The 2D image array containing the circle. 
2689            
2690        x : float
2691            The x-coordinate of the circle's center.
2692            
2693        y : float
2694            The y-coordinate of the circle's center.
2695            
2696        disp : bool, optional
2697            If True, visualizes the detected intensity profiles and peaks 
2698            (default is False).
2699    
2700        Returns
2701        -------
2702        float
2703            The estimated radius of the circle. Defaults to 100 if no valid 
2704            radius is detected.
2705        """
2706        # Helper function -----------------------------------------------------
2707        def match_peaks(arr):
2708            """
2709            Find the most similar values across the left and right halves of 
2710            an array, excluding the global maximum.
2711        
2712            This function is typically used for analyzing symmetric patterns 
2713            such as diffraction profiles or intensity histograms. It identifies 
2714            the most similar pair of peaks on either side of the central maximum, 
2715            which is excluded from the comparison.
2716        
2717            Special case:
2718            - If the array contains exactly two elements, it assumes they form 
2719              the best pair and returns their indices directly.
2720            - If one half is empty after removing the central peak,
2721              it returns (None, None).
2722        
2723            Parameters
2724            ----------
2725            arr : np.ndarray or list of float
2726                1D array of values (intensity profile) where symmetric peak
2727                positions are to be matched.
2728        
2729            Returns
2730            -------
2731            best_pair : tuple[int or None, int or None]
2732                Indices of the two most similar values, one from each half of 
2733                the array. Returns (None, None) if no valid pair is found.
2734        
2735            Notes
2736            -----
2737            - The function assumes the most prominent peak (maximum value) lies 
2738              at or near the center and represents the central feature.
2739            - The left and right halves are compared pairwise, and the closest 
2740              match in absolute value difference is returned.
2741            - This is useful for refining radial symmetry or finding symmetric 
2742              ring peaks.
2743            """
2744            if len(arr) < 2:  # Not enough values to compare
2745                if self.parent.verbose==2:
2746                    print("Not enough values to find similar pairs.")
2747                return None, None
2748    
2749            # Special case: if there are exactly 2 peaks, return them
2750            if len(arr) == 2:
2751                if self.parent.verbose==2:
2752                    print("Exactly two peaks detected. Returning them as the best pair.")
2753                return 0, 1
2754    
2755            # Find the index of the highest value
2756            center_idx = np.argmax(arr)
2757    
2758            # Split into left and right halves, excluding the highest value
2759            left = arr[:center_idx]
2760            right = arr[center_idx + 1:]
2761            left_indices = np.arange(center_idx)
2762            right_indices = np.arange(center_idx + 1, len(arr))
2763    
2764            if len(left) == 0 or len(right) == 0:  # Check for empty halves
2765                if self.parent.verbose==2:
2766                    print("One of the halves is empty.")
2767                return None, None
2768    
2769            # Initialize variables for tracking the smallest difference
2770            smallest_diff = np.inf
2771            best_pair = (None, None)
2772    
2773            # Compare each value in the left with every value in the right
2774            for i, l_val in enumerate(left):
2775                for j, r_val in enumerate(right):
2776                    diff = abs(l_val - r_val)
2777                    if diff < smallest_diff:
2778                        smallest_diff = diff
2779                        best_pair = (left_indices[i], right_indices[j])
2780    
2781            return best_pair
2782        
2783        # Peak matching method ------------------------------------------------
2784        if rtype == 0:
2785            self.xpeaks, self.ypeaks = None, None
2786            self.xyvals, self.yyvals = None, None
2787        
2788            x_line = im[int(x), :]
2789            y_line = im[:, int(y)]
2790        
2791            # Define threshold for peak detection
2792            x_thr = 0.5 * max(x_line)
2793            y_thr = 0.5 * max(y_line)
2794        
2795            # Find peaks with dynamic height thresholds
2796            self.xpeaks, _ = find_peaks(x_line, 
2797                                        height=x_thr, 
2798                                        prominence=1, 
2799                                        distance=30)
2800            self.xyvals = x_line[self.xpeaks]
2801            self.ypeaks, _ = find_peaks(y_line, 
2802                                        height=y_thr, 
2803                                        prominence=1, 
2804                                        distance=30)
2805            self.yyvals = y_line[self.ypeaks]
2806        
2807            # Define half the length of the image
2808            half_length_x = x_line.shape[0] / 2
2809            half_length_y = y_line.shape[0] / 2
2810        
2811            # Check the additional condition for xpeaks
2812            if len(self.xpeaks) == 2 and (
2813                (self.xpeaks[0]<half_length_x and self.xpeaks[1]<half_length_x) or
2814                (self.xpeaks[0]>half_length_x and self.xpeaks[1]>half_length_x)):
2815                if self.parent.verbose==2:
2816                    print("xpeaks condition met: Both peaks are on the same side of the center.")
2817                self.pairX = None
2818            else:
2819                self.pairX = match_peaks(self.xyvals)
2820        
2821            # Check the additional condition for ypeaks
2822            if len(self.ypeaks) == 2 and (
2823                (self.ypeaks[0]<half_length_y and self.ypeaks[1]<half_length_y) or
2824                (self.ypeaks[0]>half_length_y and self.ypeaks[1]>half_length_y)):
2825                if self.parent.verbose==2:
2826                    print("ypeaks condition met: Both peaks are on the same side of the center.")
2827                self.pairY = None
2828            else:
2829                self.pairY = match_peaks(self.yyvals)
2830        
2831            # Determine radius based on available pairs
2832            if self.pairX is None or None in self.pairX:
2833                rx_x = None
2834            else:
2835                x1 = self.xpeaks[self.pairX[0]]
2836                x2 = self.xpeaks[self.pairX[1]]
2837                rx_x = abs(x1 - x2) / 2
2838        
2839            if self.pairY is None or None in self.pairY:
2840                rx_y = None
2841            else:
2842                y1 = self.ypeaks[self.pairY[0]]
2843                y2 = self.ypeaks[self.pairY[1]]
2844                rx_y = abs(y1 - y2) / 2
2845        
2846            if rx_x is not None and rx_y is not None:
2847                rx = np.mean([rx_x, rx_y])
2848            elif rx_x is not None:
2849                rx = rx_x
2850            elif rx_y is not None:
2851                rx = rx_y
2852            else:
2853                if self.parent.verbose==2:
2854                    print("No valid pairs detected for radius calculation.")
2855                return 100  # Default radius or error handling
2856        
2857            if disp:
2858                # Plot xline with peaks
2859                plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
2860        
2861                # Plot for xline
2862                plt.subplot(2, 1, 1)
2863                plt.plot(x_line, label='xline')
2864                plt.plot(self.xpeaks, self.xyvals, "ro", label='Peaks')
2865                plt.title('Peaks in xline')
2866                plt.xlabel('Index')
2867                plt.ylabel('Value')
2868                plt.legend()
2869        
2870                # Plot for yline
2871                plt.subplot(2, 1, 2)
2872                plt.plot(y_line, label='yline')
2873                plt.plot(self.ypeaks, self.yyvals, "ro", label='Peaks')  
2874                plt.title('Peaks in yline')
2875                plt.xlabel('Index')
2876                plt.ylabel('Value')
2877                plt.legend()
2878        
2879                plt.tight_layout()
2880                plt.show()
2881        
2882        # Radial distribution method ------------------------------------------
2883        elif rtype == 1:
2884            profile = ediff.radial.calc_radial_distribution(
2885                im, 
2886                center=(x, y)
2887                )
2888            p0, p1 = profile
2889            idx_max = np.argmax(p1[50:]) + 50
2890            rx = p0[idx_max]
2891            max_val = p1[idx_max]
2892    
2893            if disp:
2894                fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(8, 3))
2895                axs[0].imshow(im, cmap=self.parent.cmap)
2896                axs[0].add_patch(
2897                    Circle(
2898                        (y, x), rx, 
2899                        edgecolor='red', 
2900                        fill=False, 
2901                        linewidth=2))
2902                axs[0].scatter(y, x, color="red", marker="x")
2903                axs[0].set_title("Initial Estimate")
2904                axs[0].axis('off')
2905                axs[1].plot(p0, p1)
2906                axs[1].set_ylim(0,max_val+20)
2907                axs[1].axvline(rx, 
2908                               color='red', 
2909                               linestyle='--', 
2910                               label='Initial Radius')
2911                axs[1].set_title("Radial Profile")
2912                axs[1].legend()
2913                plt.tight_layout()
2914                plt.show()
2915        
2916        # Return found radius
2917        return rx
2918
2919
2920    def backend_fft(f):
2921        """
2922        Decorator to enforce the use of PocketFFTBackend when utilizing the 
2923        `scipy.fft` module. This ensures that all FFT computations leverage 
2924        the optimized PocketFFT implementation, improving performance, 
2925        particularly for multi-threaded execution.
2926    
2927        Parameters
2928        ----------
2929        f : callable
2930            The function to be wrapped, ensuring it executes within the 
2931            PocketFFTBackend context.
2932    
2933        Returns
2934        -------
2935        callable
2936            A wrapped function that forces the use of PocketFFTBackend.
2937        """
2938        @wraps(f)
2939        def newf(*args, **kwargs):
2940            with set_backend(PocketFFTBackend):
2941                return f(*args, **kwargs)
2942        return newf
2943    
2944    @backend_fft
2945    def calc_fft(self, fft_function):
2946        """
2947        Computes the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) using the specified function.
2948
2949        This method ensures that the FFT operation is executed using 
2950        the PocketFFTBackend, applying optimized settings for improved efficiency.
2951
2952        Parameters
2953        ----------
2954        fft_function : callable
2955            The FFT function to be applied to the data.
2956
2957        Returns
2958        -------
2959        object
2960            The result of the FFT computation.
2961        """
2962        return fft_function
2963
2964   
2965    def auto_masking(self, im, threshold=0.2, show_mask=False):
2966        """
2967        Automatically generates a binary mask for an image based on intensity 
2968        thresholding.
2969        
2970        This function determines a lower intensity limit by taking a fraction 
2971        (threshold) of the median of the highest intensity values in the image. 
2972        This helps filter out noise while preserving meaningful features, 
2973        avoiding the influence of hot spots.
2974    
2975        Parameters
2976        ----------
2977        im : ndarray
2978            Input grayscale image as a 2D NumPy array.
2979        
2980        threshold : float, optional
2981            A fraction (default is 0.1) of the median of the highest intensity 
2982            values. Pixels with intensity above this computed limit will be 
2983            included in the mask.
2984    
2985        Returns
2986        -------
2987        mask : ndarray
2988            A boolean mask (same shape as `im`), where `True` indicates pixels 
2989            above the threshold and `False` represents background or noise.
2990    
2991        """
2992        # Find the median of the highest intensity value of the image to avoid 
2993        # hot spots (More stable than median scaling)
2994        lower_limit = np.percentile(im, threshold * 100) 
2995        
2996        # Generate a mask
2997        mask = im > lower_limit
2998        
2999        if show_mask:
3000            plt.figure()
3001            plt.imshow(mask)
3002            plt.title("Beam Stopper Masking")
3003            plt.tight_layout()
3004            plt.axis("off")
3005            plt.show()
3006        
3007        return mask
3008
3009        
3010    def visualize_center(self, x: float, y: float, r: float, rd: str) -> None:
3011        '''         
3012        Visualize detected diffraction patterns and mark the center.
3013        
3014        Parameters
3015        ----------
3016        tit : string
3017            name of the method used for circle detection
3018            
3019        x : float64
3020            x-coordinate of the detected center
3021            
3022        y : float64
3023            y-coordinate of the detected center
3024            
3025        r : float64
3026            radius of the detected center
3027        
3028        Returns
3029        -------
3030        None.
3031                            
3032        '''
3033        # Load image
3034        image = np.copy(self.parent.to_refine)
3035    
3036        if rd=="d":
3037            tit = "Detected center position"
3038        elif rd=="r":
3039            tit = "Refined center position"
3040        else: 
3041            tit = "Center position"
3042            
3043            
3044        if self.parent.icut is not None:
3045            im = np.where(image > self.parent.icut, self.parent.icut, image)
3046        else:
3047            im = np.copy(image)
3048            
3049        # Create a figure and display the image
3050        fig, ax = plt.subplots()
3051        
3052        # Allow using arrows to move back and forth between view ports
3053        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].append('left')
3054        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].append('right')
3055 
3056        plt.title(tit)
3057        ax.axis('off')
3058
3059        # Plot center point
3060        ax.scatter(x,y,
3061                label= f'center:  [{x:.1f}, {y:.1f}]',
3062                marker='x', color="red", s=60)
3063
3064        plt.legend(loc='upper right')
3065        
3066        # Display the image
3067        ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.parent.cmap, origin="upper")
3068        plt.axis('off')
3069        plt.tight_layout()
3070        plt.show(block=False)
3071
3072
3073
3074class CenterRefinement:
3075    '''
3076    CenterRefinement - Final refinement of the center of a diffraction pattern.
3077
3078    This class performs refinement of the detected center coordinates in a 2D
3079    diffraction pattern. It supports multiple refinement methods, both manual
3080    and automatic, and optionally saves the refined center to a file.
3081
3082
3083    Parameters
3084    ----------
3085    parent : CenterLocator
3086        Reference to the parent CenterLocator object. Used to access shared
3087        attributes like initial center estimates and configuration flags.
3088        
3089    input_image : str, Path, or numpy.ndarray
3090        The diffraction pattern image, either as a file path or a 2D NumPy array.
3091    
3092        
3093    refinement : str or None, optional, default=None
3094        The refinement method to apply. Options include:
3095        - 'manual': Manual adjustment via user interaction on the selected ring.
3096        - 'sum'   : Automatic refinement by maximizing the intensity sum 
3097        - 'var'   : Automatic refinement by minimizing the intensity variance
3098        If None, no refinement is applied.
3099          
3100    out_file : str, optional
3101        Path to a text file where the refined center coordinates will be saved.
3102    
3103    heq : bool, optional, default=False
3104        Whether to apply histogram equalization to the input image before
3105        processing.
3106    
3107    icut : float, optional, default=None
3108        Cut-off intensity level for processing the image
3109        
3110    cmap : str, optional, default='gray'
3111        Colormap to be used when displaying the image for manual refinement.
3112    
3113    verbose : bool, optional, default=False
3114        Flag to enable or disable informational verbose during processing. 
3115
3116    print_sums : bool, optional, default=False
3117        If True, prints the sum of intensity values for the refined circle 
3118        after each adjustment, relevant only for manual refinement methods.
3119
3120    Returns
3121    -------
3122    None
3123
3124    Notes
3125    -----
3126    - If an unsupported refinement method is provided, the program exits with
3127      an error.
3128    - The coordinates `xx`, `yy`, and radius `rr` can be accessed after
3129      initialization for further analysis or saving.
3130    - The refinement strategy relies on initial estimates provided by the parent 
3131      object.
3132    - Manual refinement supports click-based center adjustments guided by visual 
3133      feedback.
3134    - Sum/variance refinement automatically searches for the most likely center
3135      by evaluating ring statistics.
3136    '''
3137    
3138    def __init__(self, parent,
3139                 input_image, 
3140                 refinement = None,
3141                 in_file = None,
3142                 out_file = None,
3143                 heq = False, 
3144                 icut = None,
3145                 cmap = 'gray',
3146                 verbose = 0,
3147                 print_sums = False):
3148        
3149        ######################################################################
3150        # PRIVATE FUNCTION: Initialize CenterLocator object.
3151        # The parameters are described above in class definition.
3152        ######################################################################
3153        
3154        ## (0) Initialize input attributes ------------------------------------
3155        self.parent = parent
3156        
3157        ## (1) Initialize new attributes --------------------------------------
3158        self.step=0.5
3159        
3160        ## (2) Run functions --------------------------------------------------
3161        if refinement is not None:
3162            # Flag for later
3163            self.ret = 1
3164            par_short = self.parent.center1
3165        
3166            if refinement == "manual":
3167                # Manual refinement method
3168                if parent.determination == 'manual':
3169                    self.xx, self.yy, self.rr = \
3170                        par_short.x, par_short.y, par_short.r
3171                    par_short.x, par_short.y = \
3172                        par_short.backip[0], par_short.backip[1]
3173                    if (self.parent.verbose or self.parent.final_print):
3174                        self.parent.rText = \
3175                            "Center Refinement (Interactive)       : ({:.3f}, {:.3f})"
3176                elif parent.determination == 'intensity':
3177                    self.yy, self.xx, self.rr = self.ref_interactive(
3178                        par_short.y, par_short.x, par_short.r)
3179                else:
3180                    self.yy, self.xx, self.rr = self.ref_interactive(
3181                        par_short.x, par_short.y, par_short.r)
3182        
3183            elif refinement == "var":
3184                # Intensity variance refinement
3185                self.xx, self.yy, self.rr = self.ref_var(
3186                    par_short.x, par_short.y, par_short.r)
3187        
3188            elif refinement == "sum":
3189                # Intensity sum refinement
3190                self.xx, self.yy, self.rr = self.ref_sum(
3191                    par_short.x, par_short.y, par_short.r,
3192                    live_plot=self.parent.live_plot)
3193            
3194
3195            else:
3196                print("Selected refinement method is not supported.")
3197                sys.exit()
3198       
3199            plt.close("all")          
3200        else: 
3201            # Flag for later
3202            self.ret = 2
3203            
3204           
3205    def ref_interactive(self, px, py, pr):
3206        """
3207        Manual/interactive refinement of the diffraction pattern center.
3208      
3209        This method allows the user to fine-tune the estimated center
3210        and radius of a diffraction ring through interactive keyboard controls.
3211      
3212        An new window is opened and the user can adjust the position
3213        of the diffraction ring using the following keys (keyboard controls):
3214        - Arrow keys (, , , ): Move the center left, right, up, or down
3215        - '+' : Increase the radius
3216        - '-' : Decrease the radius
3217        - 'b' : Increase step size (5)
3218        - 'l' : Decrease step size (/5, with minimum step size 0.5)
3219        - 'd' : Done  finalize the center and radius
3220        - Closing the figure: Cancels refinement and returns the original input 
3221          center and radius
3222      
3223        Parameters
3224        ----------
3225        fig : matplotlib.figure.Figure
3226            The figure window used for interactive refinement.
3227            
3228        circle : matplotlib.patches.Circle
3229            The circle object known from
3230            the previous step = from the center determination.
3231            
3232        center : tuple
3233            The initial (x, y) center coordinates from
3234            the previous step = from the center determination.
3235            
3236        plot_results : bool, optional, default=False
3237            If True, the results of the adjustment are visualized.
3238      
3239        Returns
3240        -------
3241        xy[0] : float
3242            x-coordinate of the adjusted center of the diffraction pattern.
3243            
3244        xy[1] : float
3245            y-coordinate of the adjusted center of the diffraction pattern.
3246            
3247        r : float
3248            Adjusted radius of the diffraction ring.
3249      
3250        Notes
3251        -----
3252        - Interactive adjustments are visualized in real time.
3253        - Intensity sum at the current center/radius is printed
3254          if *print_sums* argument is True.
3255        - Arrow key defaults in Matplotlib (e.g., navigation)
3256          are temporarily disabled to allow movement control.
3257        """
3258             
3259        # (0) Load original image ---------------------------------------------
3260        im = np.copy(self.parent.to_refine)
3261
3262        # Edit contrast with a user-predefined parameter
3263        if self.parent.icut is not None:
3264            if self.parent.verbose==2:
3265                print("Contrast enhanced.")
3266            im = np.where(im > self.parent.icut, 
3267                              self.parent.icut, 
3268                              im)
3269            
3270        # (1) Initialize variables and flags ----------------------------------
3271        xy = np.array((px, py))
3272        r = np.copy(pr)
3273        termination_flag = False
3274
3275        # (2) User information ------------------------------------------------
3276        if (self.parent.verbose==1 or self.parent.verbose==2):
3277            instructions = dedent("""
3278            
3279            Interactive refinement. Use these keys:
3280                  - '' : move left
3281                  - '' : move right
3282                  - '' : move up
3283                  - '' : move down
3284                  - '+' : increase circle radius
3285                  - '-' : decrease circle radius
3286                  - 'b' : increase step size
3287                  - 'l' : decrease step size
3288                  - 'd' : refinement done
3289                  
3290            DISCLAIMER: For the purpose of the center shift, the default
3291            shortcuts for left and right arrows were removed.
3292            """)
3293            print(instructions)
3294        
3295        if self.parent.print_sums:
3296            print("Intensity sums during refinement:")
3297            
3298        # (3) Create a figure and display the image ---------------------------
3299        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 12))
3300        
3301        # Allow using arrows to move back and forth between view ports
3302        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].append('left')
3303        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].append('right')
3304        
3305        circle = plt.Circle(
3306            (px, py), pr, color='r', fill=False)
3307        ax.add_artist(circle)
3308
3309        # Plot center point
3310        center, = ax.plot(px, py, 'rx', markersize=12)
3311                    
3312        plt.title('Manually adjust the center position.', 
3313                  fontsize=20)
3314
3315        ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.parent.cmap, origin="upper")
3316        ax.axis('off')
3317        
3318        # (4) Enable interactive mode -----------------------------------------
3319        plt.ion()
3320        
3321
3322        # (5) Display the image -----------------------------------------------
3323        # fig.set_size_inches(self.fig_width, self.fig_height)
3324        plt.show(block=False)
3325        
3326        # (6) Define the event handler for figure close event -----------------
3327        def onclose(event):
3328            nonlocal termination_flag
3329            termination_flag = True
3330 
3331        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
3332        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
3333
3334        # (7) Define the callback function for key press events ---------------
3335        def onkeypress2(event):
3336            # Use nonlocal to modify the center position in the outer scope
3337            nonlocal xy, r, termination_flag
3338        
3339            # OTHER KEYS USED IN INTERACTIVE FIGURES
3340            #   event.key == '1': select a point in self.detection_3points()
3341            #   event.key == '2': delete the last point in self.detection...
3342            #   event.key == '3': delete a point in self.detection...
3343            #   event.key == '+': increase circle radius
3344            #   event.key == '-': decrease circle radius           
3345            #   event.key == 'b': increase the step size (big step size)
3346            #   event.key == 'l': decrease the step size (little step size)
3347            #   event.key == 'd': proceed in self.detection_3points()
3348        
3349            if event.key in ['up', 'down', 'left', 'right', '+', '-']:                    
3350                if event.key in ['+', '-']:
3351                    r += 1 if event.key == '+' else -1
3352                else:
3353                    # Perform shifts normally
3354                    if event.key == 'up':
3355                        xy[1] -= self.step
3356                    elif event.key == 'down':
3357                        xy[1] += self.step
3358                    elif event.key == 'left':
3359                        xy[0] -= self.step
3360                    elif event.key == 'right':
3361                        xy[0] += self.step
3362                    
3363                    # Print sum only for arrow keys
3364                    if self.parent.print_sums:
3365                        s = self.parent.intensity_sum(self.parent.to_refine, 
3366                                                      xy[0], xy[1], r)
3367                        print(f'{s:.2f}')
3368            
3369            # Terminate the interactive refinement with 'd' key
3370            if event.key == 'd':
3371                termination_flag = True
3372        
3373            # Change step size 
3374            if event.key == 'b':
3375                self.step = self.step * 5
3376        
3377            if event.key == 'l':
3378                self.step = self.step / 5
3379                if self.step < 0.5:
3380                    self.step = 0.5
3381        
3382            # Update the plot with the new center position
3383            circle.set_center((xy[0], xy[1]))  # circle
3384            circle.set_radius(r)               # radius
3385            center.set_data([xy[0]], [xy[1]])  # center
3386        
3387            plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
3388        
3389            # Update the plot
3390            plt.draw()
3391
3392            
3393        # Disconnect the on_key_press1 event handler from the figure
3394        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(fig.canvas.manager.key_press_handler_id)
3395        
3396        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
3397        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress2)
3398
3399        # Enable interaction mode
3400        plt.ion() 
3401               
3402        # Wait for 'd' key press or figure closure
3403        while not termination_flag:
3404            try:
3405                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
3406            except KeyboardInterrupt:
3407                # If the user manually closes the figure, terminate the loop
3408                termination_flag = True
3409         
3410        # (8) Turn off interactive mode ---------------------------------------
3411        plt.ioff()
3412        
3413        # Display the final figure with the selected center position and radius
3414        plt.tight_layout()
3415
3416        plt.show(block=False)
3417        
3418        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
3419        if termination_flag: 
3420            plt.close()  # Close the figure
3421
3422        # User information:
3423        if (self.parent.verbose or self.parent.final_print):
3424            self.parent.rText = "Center Refinement (Interactive)       : ({:.3f}, {:.3f})"
3425
3426        return xy[0], xy[1], r    
3427        
3428    
3429    def ref_var(self, px, py, pr, plot_results=0):
3430        """
3431        Refine the center coordinates (px, py) and radius (pr) of a circular 
3432        diffraction pattern by minimizing the variance of pixel intensities 
3433        along the circle's border.
3434
3435        This method performs iterative local search in the 8-neighbourhood 
3436        around the current center to find a position and radius that minimize 
3437        the intensity variance. The refinement stops when convergence criteria 
3438        are met or after a maximum number of iterations.
3439
3440        Neighborhood pattern tested (o = current center, x = candidate center):
3441            x x x   --> (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) (px + dx, py + dy)
3442            x o x   --> (px - dx, py)      (px, py)      (px + dx, py)
3443            x x x   --> (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)
3444
3445        Parameters
3446        ----------
3447        px : float
3448            Initial x-coordinate of the detected center.
3449            
3450        py : float
3451            Initial y-coordinate of the detected center.
3452            
3453        pr : float
3454            Initial radius of the detected circular pattern.
3455            
3456        plot_results : int, optional (default=0)
3457            Whether to plot the refinement result (1 = yes, 0 = no).
3458
3459        Returns
3460        -------
3461        px : float
3462            Refined x-coordinate of the center.
3463            
3464        py : float
3465            Refined y-coordinate of the center.
3466            
3467        pr : float
3468            Refined radius of the circular pattern.
3469
3470        Notes
3471        -----
3472        - The function avoids overfitting to local minima by enforcing 
3473          convergence thresholds and consistency checks.
3474        - If the refinement worsens the initial variance significantly or 
3475          suggests an invalid coordinate swap, the original input is preserved.
3476        - Uses `self.parent.intensity_variance()` for evaluating the criterion.
3477        """
3478        
3479        # Store input for plot
3480        bckup = [np.copy(px), np.copy(py), np.copy(pr)]
3481        
3482        # Load image
3483        image = np.copy(self.parent.image)
3484
3485        # Starting values to be modified 
3486        init_var = self.parent.intensity_variance(image, px, py, pr)
3487        min_intensity_var = self.parent.intensity_variance(image, px, py, pr)
3488        best_center = (np.copy(px), np.copy(py))
3489        best_radius = np.copy(pr)
3490    
3491        # Convergence criterion for termination of gradient optimization 
3492        # (1) small positive value that serves as a threshold to determine 
3493        #     when the optimization process has converged
3494        convergence_threshold = 0.1*min_intensity_var
3495        
3496        # (2) maximum number of iterations of optimization
3497        max_iterations = 10
3498        
3499        # (3) keep track of the number of consecutive iterations where there 
3500        #     is no improvement in the objective function beyond 
3501        #     the convergence threshold
3502        no_improvement_count = 0
3503    
3504    
3505        # iterative refinement of the center of a circle while keeping
3506        # the radius constant.
3507        step = 0.3
3508        neighbors = [(float(dx), float(dy))
3509            for dx in np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)
3510            for dy in np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)]
3511        
3512        for iteration in range(max_iterations):    
3513            # Refine center while keeping radius constant
3514            curr = self.parent.intensity_variance(image, 
3515                                      best_center[0], 
3516                                      best_center[1], 
3517                                      best_radius) 
3518            # Store intensity sums of the current center's neighborhood
3519            curr_intensity_var = []
3520            for dx, dy in neighbors:
3521                nx, ny = best_center[0] + dx, best_center[1] + dy
3522                # Check if the point is within the expanded search radius
3523                curr_intensity_var.append(
3524                    self.parent.intensity_variance(image, nx, ny, best_radius))
3525            
3526            # Find the minimum value coordinates within curr_intensity_var
3527            cx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmin(curr_intensity_var),
3528                                     [len(curr_intensity_var),1])
3529                    
3530            # Check for improvement of criterion -- in each iteration just once,
3531            # as the algorithm checks the neighbourhood of the best center (in
3532            # each iteration, the center is updated if possible)
3533            if min(curr_intensity_var) <= min_intensity_var:                           
3534                min_intensity_var = max(curr_intensity_var)
3535                
3536                # Calculate the new best coordinates of the center
3537                n = neighbors[cx]
3538                (nx, ny) = tuple(map(lambda x, y: float(x) + float(y), 
3539                                     best_center, n))
3540                best_center = px, py = (np.copy(nx), np.copy(ny))
3541                
3542            # Update maximum intensity sum 
3543            min_intensity_var = self.parent.intensity_variance(image, 
3544                                                    best_center[0], 
3545                                                    best_center[1], 
3546                                                    best_radius) 
3547            
3548            # Refine radius if necessary while keeping the center position 
3549            # constant. It iterates through different radius adjustments
3550            # to find a radius that maximizes the intensity sum of pixels.
3551            
3552            radi_intensity_var = []
3553            radii = np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)
3554            for dr in radii:
3555                new_radius = best_radius + dr
3556                radi_intensity_var.append(self.parent.intensity_variance(image, 
3557                                                             best_center[0], 
3558                                                             best_center[1], 
3559                                                             new_radius))
3560                
3561            # Find the minimum value coordinates within curr_var
3562            rx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmin(radi_intensity_var),
3563                                      [len(radi_intensity_var),1])
3564            
3565            # Check for improvement of criterion
3566            if max(radi_intensity_var) < min_intensity_var:
3567                min_intensity_var = max(radi_intensity_var)
3568                
3569                n = radii[rx]
3570                nr = best_radius+n
3571                
3572                best_radius = pr = np.copy(nr)
3573
3574            
3575            # Check for convergence and improvement (termination conditions)
3576            impr = abs(min_intensity_var - curr)
3577            if impr < convergence_threshold:
3578                no_improvement_count += 1
3579                if no_improvement_count == 5:
3580                    break
3581        
3582        # Avoid incorrect/redundant refinement
3583        ## (1) swapped coordinates
3584        if ((bckup[0] > bckup[1] and not best_center[0] > best_center[1])
3585            or  (bckup[0] < bckup[1] and not best_center[0] < best_center[1])):
3586            best_center = best_center[::-1]
3587        
3588        ## (2) worsened final maximum intensity sum than the initial one
3589        if np.round(init_var,-2) < np.round(min_intensity_var,-2):
3590            print("Refinement redundant.")
3591            best_center = np.copy(bckup)
3592    
3593        # Print results
3594        if (self.parent.verbose or self.parent.final_print):
3595            self.parent.rText = \
3596                "Center Refinement (IntensityVar)      : ({:.3f}, {:.3f})"
3597                                  
3598        return best_center[0], best_center[1], best_radius
3599    
3600    
3601    def ref_sum(self, px, py, pr, plot_results=0, live_plot=False):
3602        """
3603        Refine the center coordinates (px, py) and radius (pr) of a circular 
3604        diffraction pattern by maximizing the summed pixel intensity along 
3605        a circular ring.
3606
3607        The method uses an iterative local search strategy based on gradient 
3608        ascent in the 8-neighbourhood around the current center to find 
3609        a position and radius that maximize the intensity sum. The center 
3610        is updated based on the best neighbor until convergence criteria 
3611        or maximum iteration limits are met.
3612
3613        Neighborhood pattern tested (o = current center, x = candidate center):
3614            x x x   --> (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) (px + dx, py + dy)
3615            x o x   --> (px - dx, py)      (px, py)      (px + dx, py)
3616            x x x   --> (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)
3617
3618        Parameters
3619        ----------
3620        px : float
3621            Initial x-coordinate of the detected center.
3622            
3623        py : float
3624            Initial y-coordinate of the detected center.
3625            
3626        pr : float
3627            Initial radius of the detected circular pattern.
3628            
3629        plot_results : int, optional (default=0)
3630            If set to 1, plots the final result of the refinement.
3631
3632        Returns
3633        -------
3634        px : float
3635            Refined x-coordinate of the center.
3636            
3637        py : float
3638            Refined y-coordinate of the center.
3639            
3640        pr : float
3641            Refined radius of the circular pattern.
3642
3643        Notes
3644        -----
3645        - Uses `self.parent.intensity_sum()` as the optimization criterion.
3646        - Alternates between optimizing the center and the radius.
3647        - Stops after no significant improvement over multiple iterations.
3648        - If refinement worsens the result, the original values are retained.
3649        """
3650        # Store input for plot via self.visualize_refinement()
3651        bckup = [np.copy(px), np.copy(py), np.copy(pr)]
3652    
3653        # Image in which the center is refined
3654        image = np.copy(self.parent.image)
3655    
3656        # Starting values to be modified 
3657        init_sum = self.parent.intensity_sum(image, px, py, pr)
3658        max_intensity_sum = self.parent.intensity_sum(image, px, py, pr)
3659        best_center = (np.copy(px), np.copy(py))
3660        best_radius = np.copy(pr)
3661        
3662        # Convergence criterion for termination of gradient optimization 
3663        # (1) small positive value that serves as a threshold to determine 
3664        #     when the optimization process has converged
3665        convergence_threshold = 0.05*max_intensity_sum
3666        
3667        # (2) maximum number of iterations of optimization
3668        max_iterations = 100
3669        
3670        # (3) keep track of the number of consecutive iterations where there 
3671        #     is no improvement in the objective function beyond 
3672        #     the convergence threshold
3673        no_improvement_count = 0
3674         
3675        # iterative refinement of the center of a circle while keeping
3676        # the radius constant.
3677        step = 0.2
3678        neighbors = [(float(dx), float(dy))
3679            for dx in np.arange(-1.0, 1.0 + step, step)
3680            for dy in np.arange(-1.0, 1.0 + step, step)]
3681        
3682        # Live plot initialization 
3683        if live_plot:
3684            plt.ion()
3685            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
3686            ax.imshow(image, cmap='gray')
3687            circ_artist = Circle(best_center, best_radius, 
3688                                 fill=False, color='red', lw=1.5)
3689            ax.add_patch(circ_artist)
3690            ax.set_title("Refinement Progress")
3691            ax.axis("off")
3692            fig.show()
3693
